member.name: T:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory
member.summary: The default HTTP client factory
member.remarks: Any other implementation should derive from this class, because it contains serveral useful utility functions for the creation of a HTTP client and request message.

member.name: T:RestSharp.Portable.IHttpClientFactory
member.summary: Interface to allow custom creation of HttpClient and HttpRequestMessage objects
member.remarks: The DefaultHttpClientFactory contains some helpful protected methods that helps gathering the data required for a proper configuration of the HttpClient.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.IHttpClientFactory.CreateClient(RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient,RestSharp.Portable.IRestRequest)
member.summary: Create the client
member.param: The REST client that wants to create the HTTP client
The REST request for which the HTTP client is created
member.returns: A new HttpClient object
member.remarks: The DefaultHttpClientFactory contains some helpful protected methods that helps gathering the data required for a proper configuration of the HttpClient.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.IHttpClientFactory.CreateRequestMessage(RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient,RestSharp.Portable.IRestRequest)
member.summary: Create the request message
member.param: The REST client that wants to create the HTTP request message
The REST request for which the HTTP request message is created
member.returns: A new HttpRequestMessage object
member.remarks: The DefaultHttpClientFactory contains some helpful protected methods that helps gathering the data required for a proper configuration of the HttpClient.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory.HasCookies(RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient,RestSharp.Portable.IRestRequest)
member.summary: Returns if the HTTP client should be aware of cookies
member.returns: true == HTTP client should use a cookie container

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory.GetBaseAddress(RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient)
member.summary: Get the REST requests base address (for HTTP client)
member.returns: The base URL

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory.GetMessageAddress(RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient,RestSharp.Portable.IRestRequest)
member.summary: Get the REST requests relative address (for HTTP request message)
member.returns: The relative request message URL

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory.GetProxy(RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient)
member.summary: The proxy to be used by the HTTP client
member.returns: Proxy object or null

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory.GetCredentials(RestSharp.Portable.IRestRequest)
member.summary: Get the credentials required for the REST request
member.returns: Credentials for the HTTP client or null

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory.GetCookies(RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient,RestSharp.Portable.IRestRequest)
member.summary: Get the cookies for the HTTP client
member.returns: The cookie container or null

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory.GetHttpMethod(RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient,RestSharp.Portable.IRestRequest)
member.summary: Returns the HTTP method for the request message.
member.param: The REST client that wants to create the HTTP client
member.returns: HTTP method

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory.AddHttpHeaderParameters(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,RestSharp.Portable.IRestRequest)
member.summary: Returns a modified HTTP request message object with HTTP header parameters
member.returns: The modified HTTP request message

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory.CreateMessageHandler(RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient,RestSharp.Portable.IRestRequest)
member.summary: Create the message handler
member.param: The REST client that wants to create the HTTP client
The REST request for which the HTTP client is created
member.returns: A new HttpMessageHandler object

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.HttpClientImpl.DefaultHttpClientFactory.CreateClient(RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient,RestSharp.Portable.IRestRequest)
member.summary: Create the client
member.param: The REST client that wants to create the HTTP client
The REST request for which the HTTP client is created
member.returns: A new HttpClient object
member.remarks: The DefaultHttpClientFactory contains some helpful protected methods that helps gathering the data required for a proper configuration of the HttpClient.

member.summary: Add a new content type handler
member.param: The deserializer to decode the content
member.returns: The client itself, to allow call chains

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient.RemoveHandler(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a previously added content type handler
member.param: The Accept header value that identifies the handler
member.returns: The client itself, to allow call chains

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient.ClearHandlers
member.summary: Remove all previously added content type handlers
member.returns: The client itself, to allow call chains

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient.GetHandler(System.String)
member.summary: Get a previously added content type handler
member.param: The Accept header value that identifies the handler
member.returns: The deserializer that can handle the given content type.
member.remarks: This function returns NULL if the handler for the given content type cannot be found.

member.summary: Replace all handlers of a given type with a new deserializer
member.param: The type of the old deserializer
member.returns: The client itself, to allow call chains

member.summary: Add a new content encoding handler
member.param: The encoding engine to decode the content
member.returns: The client itself, to allow call chains

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient.RemoveEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a previously added content encoding handler
member.param: The Accept-Encoding header value that identifies the handler
member.returns: The client itself, to allow call chains

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient.ClearEncodings
member.summary: Remove all previously added content encoding handlers
member.returns: The client itself, to allow call chains

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient.GetEncoding(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Get a previously added content encoding handler
member.param: The Accept-Encoding header value that identifies the handler
member.returns: The handler that can decode the given content encoding.
member.remarks: This function returns NULL if the handler for the given content encoding cannot be found.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Portable.RestClientExtensions.BuildUri(RestSharp.Portable.IRestClient,RestSharp.Portable.IRestRequest,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Build the full URL for a request
member.param: The REST client that will execute the request
Should the resulting URL contain the query?
member.returns: Resulting URL
member.remarks: The resulting URL is a combination of the REST client's BaseUrl and the REST requests Resource, where all URL segments are replaced and - optionally - the query parameters added.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.MD5Managed
member.summary: MD5Managed: A HashAlgorithm implementation that acts as a thin wrapper around a C# translation of the MD5 reference implementation. The C code has been translated as closely as possible so that most of the original structure remains and comparisons between the two are straightforward.
member.remarks:
Derived from the RSA Data Security, Inc. MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm.
Specification: RFC1321 - The MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc1321.html
Original license: Copyright (C) 1991-2, RSA Data Security, Inc. Created 1991. All rights reserved.
License to copy and use this software is granted provided that it is identified as the "RSA Data Security, Inc. MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm" in all material mentioning or referencing this software or this function.
License is also granted to make and use derivative works provided that such works are identified as "derived from the RSA Data Security, Inc. MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm" in all material mentioning or referencing the derived work.
RSA Data Security, Inc. makes no representations concerning either the merchantability of this software or the suitability of this software for any particular purpose. It is provided "as is" without express or implied warranty of any kind.
These notices must be retained in any copies of any part of this documentation and/or software.
